snippet: The administration has not nominated an envoy to Ireland since the last one left in 2012, and the delay has bruised feelings.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; Obama administration has not nominated a new ambassador to Ireland since Dan Rooney left post in December 2012; 14-month gap between envoys, longest since 1927, has cast a pall over Irish-American relations, especially as Pres Obama meets with Irish Prime Min Enda Kenny for St Patrick's Day celebration.
lead_paragraph: The administration has not nominated an envoy to Ireland since the last one left in 2012, and the delay has bruised feelings.

headline.main: Absence of U.S. Envoy in Dublin Looms Over White House St. Patrick’s Day
headline.print_headline: Lack of Envoy Puts a Shadow on the Shamrock
